org.flowvisor.ofswitch

Class TopologyController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.flowvisor.ofswitch.OFSwitchAcceptor
      • org.flowvisor.ofswitch.TopologyController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FVEventHandler

    public class TopologyController
extends OFSwitchAcceptor
    A simple OpenFlow controller that runs inside the flowvisor to discover and report the network's topology Can only run one instance of topology controller at a time; use spawn() to create or get running instance
    Author:
    capveg

        public void registerCallBack(java.lang.String user,
                    java.lang.String URL,
                    java.lang.String methodName,
                    java.lang.String cookie,
                    java.lang.String callbackType)
        Add a new URL to the list of things to make an XMLRPC call to if the topology changes
        Parameters:
        user - FVUser (e.g., "alice") who registered this callback
        URL - Location of user's xmlrpc server
        cookie - Some state locally meaningful to user

      • handleEvent

        public void handleEvent(FVEvent e)
                 throws UnhandledEvent
        Description copied from interface: FVEventHandler
        Pass a message to this Handler. If the dst is in the same thread context as the caller, the message is processed immediately (blocking) Else, the message is queued and processed later (non-blocking) If sender is null, the message is always queued
        Specified by:
        handleEvent in interface FVEventHandler
        Overrides:
        handleEvent in class OFSwitchAcceptor
        Parameters:
        e - A FVEvent
        Throws:
        UnhandledEvent

      • listDevices

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> listDevices()
        Return a list of datapath ids (encoded as raw longs) of all the switches/devices connected to this topology controller Used by FVUserAPI getDevices() call
        Returns:
        never null, may return an empty list if nothing is connected
